summary: The MAILS Act mandates the U.S. Postal Service to improve communication with local communities regarding post office relocations and establishments. It requires the Postal Service to establish a process for local requests for new post offices, mandates community input for temporary relocations longer than two days, and necessitates notification to elected officials and public presentations before temporary relocations. Furthermore, it requires the Postal Service to submit reports to relevant congressional committees for temporary relocations exceeding 180 days, explaining communication adherence and any extensions.
